content:
Hi All,
We are looking for guidance for appropriate resource or profile to implement concept to multi disciplinary tumor board meeting.
Here patient does not present physician.
It is a meeting between subject experts to evaluate Patient current state and next course of action.
We try to emulate this using Encounter but seems like Patient or a Proxy should be present in Encounter/Visit. But in this case it is specific meeting between only Practitioners and Experts.
Appointment would be ok for the planned meeting, but not for the meeting itself. @Brian Postlethwaite ?
IIRC, @Reinhard Egelkraut and @Oliver Krauss did a whole bunch of work around modeling tumor boards.

Yupp. There is two publicly available publications on that topic from us: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/305908766_Multidisciplinary_Team_Meetings_-_A_Literature_Based_Process_Analysis

http://ebooks.iospress.nl/publication/46461

Also @Reinhard Egelkraut , @Andreas Schuler and me are all three here at the Montreal WGM if you are here and wanna talk in person @Shubham Sharma

Also a slightly more technical presentation (than the papers) here from the DevDays: https://vimeopro.com/firelyteam/hl7-fhir-developer-days-2016-amsterdam/video/191965726

TLDR.: The Appointment is used for planning the timeslot, but to collect the data necessary, and also document the meeting itself we use two resources. Firstly Compositon to collect the medical data. Secondly CarePlan to log the actual process from a FHIR perspective
We did profile that, but the profile is not available anywhere publicly I think. You can talk to @Reinhard Egelkraut about cooperating / getting a copy though
That will be really helpful if we can get a copy of profiles to start with.
Unfortunately, I will not be there. But some of my colleagues will be there. I will loop through them for same purpose.
@Halina Labikova is there in Montreal. She will get in touch.
